title: Aesthetic Function in Space

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on masonite and cardboard with mirror, in artist-painted frame.

description: A pioneering modernist working in Los Angeles from the 1920s until the early 1950s, Knud Merrild believed that avant-garde artists should challenge the boundaries of the picture plane by expanding outward. He assembled Aesthetic Function in Space out of shaped pieces of Masonite, corrugated cardboard, wood, and a small mirror, layering the forms to create a three-dimensional construction that unites elements of painting, collage, and sculpture. Described as being a “space composition” or “space painting,” this work is an early American example of a wall construction. It is also the first to be made by any California artist, noteworthy given Merrild’s distance from avant-garde art centers. When exhibited in San Francisco, local critics noted the work’s highly radical form, referring to it as “one of the most ultra of the modern paintings.”
medium_display: Oil on Masonite and cardboard with mirror, in artist-painted frame
inscriptions: Signed and dated lower right: Knud Merrild 1928-33
credit_line: Gift of Dale Taylor and Angela Lustig
exhibition_history:
San Francisco, Paul Elder Gallery, Feb. 1935, no cat.

Los Angeles, Hollywood Gallery of Modern Art, Knud Merrild: Exhibition of Recent Works, July 10–31, 1935, cat. 4.

Los Angeles, Transigram Sound Studios, First Annual Exhibit of Painting and Sculpture, Aug. 1–17, 1935, cat. 8.

San Francisco Museum of Art, Knud Merrild Oil Paintings, Mar. 8–30, 1937, checklist XX. 

Copenhagen, Dams & Fonss, Knud Merrild, 1938, cat. 1. 

New York, Boyer Galleries, Knud Merrild, Feb. 1–21, 1939, cat. 19.

Beverly Hills, Ca., Modern Institute of Art, Knud Merrild: Twenty Five Year Retrospective, June 2–July 4, 1948, cat. 3. 

Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Knud Merrild, 1894–1954, Nov. 26–Dec. 26, 1965, cat. 12, ill. 

Los Angeles, Steve Turner Gallery, Twentieth Century American Art, 1995, cat. 28, ill. 

New York, Hirschl & Adler Galleries, Eccentric Orbits: Stanley William Hayter, Charles Howard, Knud Merrild, Kay Sage, Apr. 9–May 29, 1998, ill. 

Los Angeles, Steve Turner Gallery, Knud Merrild: State of Flux, May 4–June 17, 2001, ill.

Pasadena Museum of California Art, Post Surrealism, June 1–Sept. 1, 2002; Logan, Utah, Nora Eccles Harrison Museum of Art, Utah State University, Oct. 11, 2002–Jan. 24, 2003 (unnumbered cat.).

Chicago, Valerie Carberry Gallery, Knud Merrild, Nov. 3–Dec. 20, 2008, cat. 8.
provenance_text: The artist; bequeathed to his widow, Mrs. Else Merrild, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1954; by descent in the family until 1989; to a private collection, Stockholm, 1989; to Steve Turner Gallery, Los Angeles, 1991; to a private collection, Los Angeles; [Valerie Carberry Gallery, Chicago]; sold to Dale Taylor and Angela Lustig, Chicago, 2008; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2016
